comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: This was just a bit before my time but I remember much of it as it was then.  The shops on the left were still in full swing, the building with the arched windows on the left was the old Limerick Corporation building and meeting room.  My mother was born in the second street on the left, Ellen Street and in the haze on the right is Cannocks clock, a Limerick landmark.  My earliest memory of Patrick Street was standing on the pavement waiting for the "An Tostal" parade to take place there and seeing a Garda Inspector or Superintendent in their lighter blue uniform walking about with a walking stick.  Those sticks were in use until the early 1970's after the Conroy Commission brought in lots of changes to the service.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Wow, what a memory! If you have a few moments, please feel free to tag or add notes showing the various locations, as we've little or no info on this one...
